pros: 1. Everyone is really nice, has a great atmosphere, and makes you feel really connected to the uni 2. Fits around your timetable 3. Staff discount 4. There is a possibility to continue work after you have graduated 5. Customers are usually students as well, so in general very nice
cons: The whole experience really depends on the duty manager/people you work with, the work itself is a standard pub job

pros: Learn a lot and face lots of challenging situations that will test and develop your skills. Get to work with a wide range of actors, students and members of the community which will help to develop your communication and team skills. People are generally friendly and the company has a flat structure so you can branch into many adjacent areas of work and different projects outside of your role.
cons: Very unclear and inconsistently enforced rules. Generally at the mercy of whatever fever dream the officers have had that week. Lack of boundaries in some scenarios. A lot of pressure, expectation and urgency on work. Not the best pay. Many people were burnt out or had their mental health negatively impacted from the work they were doing. Lack of long term planning within the organisation

pros: Good company to work for Very student orientated and understanding of studies
cons: Late night hours (expected with a bar job)

review_title: It's a pretty standard student job
pros: Flexible holiday Decent renumeration Good options for management promotion
cons: Badly run Management team CEO holds questionable views and has said questionable things to minority employees

job_title: CSA (Customer Service Assistant) in Brighton, England
pros: Flexible, amazing team, lots of socials, career opportunity and training
cons: The only con could be the minimum wage

pros: Community and flexibility in hours
cons: Lack of hours and good communication

pros: Flexible hours and supportive, fun atmosphere
cons: Repetitive work, little career progression

pros: Good atmosphere and benefits with staff discount
cons: Higher management poor at scheduling, hours run over

job_title: Customer Service Assistant in Brighton, England
pros: Awesome co-workers, great flexibility around uni schedule, discounted food on shift
cons: None, loved the experience so much!

pros: flexible with lots of holiday!
cons: repetitive work, minimal chance to progress

job_title: Customer Service Assistant in Brighton, England
pros:
Flexible with hours within the term
Fun Atmosphere
cons:
Pay isn't amazing
Short shifts can be annoying

pros:
1. Regular employee trainings
2. Considerate and flexible
3. Friendly
cons: 1. Lack of clear instructions

pros: A good place to start your career
cons: Tons of staff that's more interested in protecting their jobs than doing meaningful work

pros: Flexibility around studies, good student job
cons: limited progression opportunities, high turnover of staff

review_title: Great employer, flexible work around studies`
pros: Good pay, flexible working hours around study, supportive management
cons: Some late night work occasionally required

pros: Great community, good employees and easy system to work in while at university
cons: Can be stressful and anxiety inducing as I worked in a bar full of student customers

job_title: Customer Service Assistant in Brighton, England
pros: Helped preserve the student experience
cons: Slow decision making and disconect between managment and footmen

review_title: Good place to work on campus
pros: they accommodate your work schedule around academics
cons:
You may get random hours every week
No off days during the exam season

pros: Flexible and friendly work enviroment
cons: Short breaks and some early mornings

pros:
Work around your university schedule
Good pay!!
Usually working with people your age/good to meet people
cons: The management are a bit of a pain

pros: Amazing, passionate people who are all there working in the interest of students. A very dynamic and ever changing environment. Gave me a chance to gain skills I wouldn’t have elsewhere. Welcoming and friendly staff.
cons: Often very fast paced, and staff are often stressed and over worked. It’s not always clear what the direction of the organisation is, regardless of what officers are in post, there is no consistent leadership. There is often very little room for progression, or support for staff learning and development. Communication within the organisation is not always consistent which can lead to confusion and further staff stress.

pros: Great people working here. Flexible working. Great work culture as well as efforts for improving inclusivity. Really rewarding work
cons: It's a charity so the budgets can be low/unpredictable. Low salary.

review_title: Fun and friendly place to work
job_title: Policy and Research Assistant in Brighton, England
pros: I was given a lot of trust and responsibility, but also given a great amount of support at the same time. Everyone is super friendly, supportive and caring.
cons: No cons really, it's a fab place to work!

job_title: Customer Service Assistant in Brighton, England
pros: GOOD for everything. Would recommend
cons: N/A-Covid 19 had a big impact on company

job_title: Customer Service Assistant in Brighton, England
pros: Fun to work with other students
cons: Not a lot of support. Not very organised

pros: Being able to work in a team of students whilst providing for students has been a highlight; everyone understands our situations regarding work and University as we are all in the same boat. Very good wage for the work. Being able to work as few or as many hours (within reason) as you want is useful for students.
cons: High-pressure environment which can cause issues for some. Serving 15,000 students and staff can make for incredibly busy work, but as long as you manage it correctly this should not be much of an issue.

pros:
- Flexible working hours around university timetable.
- Convenient for students and good pay for the job.
- Friendly staff, supervisors and managers.
cons:
- Finance department tend to under pay and you have to waste time sorting it out.
- Some weeks you cant get the hours you want due to demand from the number of staff who are working 'full-time' when they shouldn't be.

review_title: Nice people, but a lack of professionalism
pros:
- flexible work hours
- kind colleagues
- transparent workplace 
- lots of awesome volunteers
cons:
- lack of ability to develop as everyone is settled in their jobs
- poor pay for years on end
- lack of professionalism - people storming out 
- office politics took over when it should not be the priority
- lack of work life balance leads to stress for many employees
- processes are long, particularly financial ones, more efficiency is needed in this area

review_title: Wonderful time as a Customer Service Assistant at the SU's Shop
job_title: Customer Service Assistant in Brighton, England
pros:
- Flexible timing (minimum 5.5 hours required per week)
- Great hourly wage for a part-time job in Brighton
- Great social culture, made a lot of friends
- Excellent training and advice provided
- Performance scores to keep you motivated
- Possibility of becoming supervisor if you really put in the effort
cons: - Could get a bit clique-y at times

job_title: Human Resources Manager in Falmer, England
pros: I'm obviously biased because I work here but I whole heartily believe it's a great place to work. The people are fantastically supportive, and while there will always be things we can work on, and will do our best to improve, ultimately I would always recommend this as a great place to work.
cons: You'll probably never get to the bottom of your to-do list

review_title: Great place to work - particularly for student staff!
pros:
- Work hours are highly flexible and built around your schedule
- LOADS of support for learning and growth
- Wages are great compared to other student jobs
- Warm and  encouraging work environment
cons: - Work can get repetitive sometimes

pros: Good social life within the staff and bars
cons: Some shifts are far worse than others, and favouritism tends to dictate who gets the good shifts. Not many benefits for working bad shifts

review_title: Good if a bit chaotic at times
job_title: CSA Bar Staff in Brighton, England
pros: Good sense of being supported in terms of friendships and mental health issues.
cons: Can be somewhat disorganised at times and not always efficiently run.

pros: Great place strong support and fabulous work ethics
cons: Pay structure needs updating

review_title: A great place to work with some fabulous people
pros: The people are wonderful. Supportive, friendly and empowering
cons: We're always battling against budgets

review_title: Sussex SU bar staff company review
pros: Very flexible and friendly workplace, well paid and great for students.
cons: Some shifts finish quite late.

pros: Friendly management, training opportunities, decently paid, very flexible
cons: some communication issues from management to DMs and CSAs

pros: Great team attitude & flexible working arrangements
cons: There are none, great part time student job!
